FIDDLING {{summoner:11}} 'd SON. These smites are the best reason to visit this board subsection.

Though I'd like to point out that I was permabanned on my first account in early S2 and started a new one, reformed completely and then was hit with a surprise zero-to-permaban (Which was nonsense, hence it was later overturned), so I think the "virtually 100%" is a slight exaggeration. Reform is highly possible with the right system.... just that the current system is draconian.

If I recall (working off memory here), your account was perma-banned to lock it until you could write in. This is often times done when an account is found during manual review in case the account is compromised. A proper ban of 14-day was then applied. This isn't the same as being overturned.

The current system is designed to maximize reform, which is why players are given in-client reform cards. It is also why we give rather light penalties for first time offenders and ramp up the severity for repetitive offenders. The exception to this is of course extreme offenses.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gxTzEErZ,comment-id=00000000000200010001,timestamp=2016-10-08T07:06:32.415+0000)

>which is why players are given in-client reform cards. 

I wasn't given a reform card, I had to put in a support ticket and go through several support staff until I was finally informed of the cause and even then it was very ambiguous... it took 8 months to finally be given full information.

You didn't get a 'zero-to-permaban' like you post.

Your account was locked, until you wrote in.

Accounts are locked for many reason. Some reasons include account compromise and payment issues. That is like saying that someone was perma-banned because someone stole their account.

You were given an email that specifically told you to write in to player support to address your account issues.

I've also explained that you didn't get a reform card because you didn't go through the instant feedback system, you case was entirely handled by hand. So, I'm not sure why you are commenting about the instant feedback system and it being draconian, when it has in fact never affected you.

You also didn't reform completely if you were being constantly reported and were 14-day banned by manual review. I've had this conversation with you so many times.

>you case was entirely handled by hand. So, I'm not sure why you are commenting about the instant feedback system and it being draconian, when it has in fact never affected you.

Rioters that hit people with zero-to-permabans are also part of the draconian system. What was the purpose in giving me the most stressful days I've ever had just to get a hold of me? that is unethical at best and straight up torturous at worst.

You can argue that it was "just an account lock" but that's not what the account said, it outright stated that I was permanently banned. This was a source of extreme stress and anxiety.... I was not told the reason for my permaban until days after the zero-to-permaban was implemented.

>  I've had this conversation with you so many times.

We've spoken twice. **TWICE**. How is that "so many times"?  And it took 8 months for me to finally get you to respond. I literally begged you to respond for 8 whole months before I finally got the full story as to what happened during that extremely distressing period.

>You also didn't reform completely if you were being constantly reported and were 14-day banned by manual review.

I understand toxicity and know it well, again this isn't my first rodeo, but zero-to-permaban? at bare minimum my account should not have read "You have been permabanned" and should have read "Your account has been locked".

This is the main reason my first response was to think my account had been hacked because Riot had complete radio silence for days before I was finally informed of the reason. Basically although I admit my misdoings, **I believe Riot GREATLY mishandled my case.**

Ex:

>It is also why we give rather light penalties for first time offenders

I was a first time offender and I was hit with a zero-to-permaban punishment which is reserved for the most extreme cases... a fraction of a fraction of the comnunity. And then when it was determined that the original assessment from the first manual review was wrong, I was STILL punished with a 14 day suspension. Forgive me Lord Tantram but...... that's bullshit.
It wasnt a perma ban, it was a lock out. Tantrum literally just explained it to you and you still cant understand!! It's actually really simple.

This "lockout" argument is bullshit. At best you are arguing semantics and failing.... all evidence points to the fact that my case was mishandled. While it did have a somewhat happy ending, it does not negate the fact that there was a huge mis-step by Riot. 

Tantram is remember wrong... or he is lying... and I say this knowing that Tantram could destroy me with a thought, if he so desired. I will stand my ground because facts, logic and reason are on my side.

This is categorically false. Premade reports only have the weight of a single report altogether. Also, reports merely flag a match for review; when a player receives too many reports in too few games a review of those matches is triggered; if negative behavior is found to be consistent and/or extreme, then they player may be punished. If they have done nothing to validate the reports then it won't hurt them, and the players making false reports will lose value in theirs. A match is flagged just the same whether it's 1 report or 9.

As for them saying 100 things and you saying 1, it doesn't really matter; all you do by retaliating with the same behavior is perpetuate the negative environment and make it worse. If someone is being a jerk in chat the only useful defense is muting and reporting them.

Even though players can mute and there is a filter, that is no excuse to be toxic. By the time a player is forced to use them you've already created a negative environment. It's up to you to control your behavior, not them.

An account ban is also not going to happen because of one game;  14 day and permabans are the 3rd and 4th steps in the [4 tiers of punishment](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Boqd81O0-upcoming-upgrades-to-chat-restrictions). To get them you must have already gone past multiple prior punishments and continued your negative behavior, or been extremely toxic so as to warrant skipping tiers.
